Children Enjoy Winter Folk Amusements
articles.content:
Children Enjoy Winter Folk Amusements
    Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- After a heavy snowfall in most parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea several days ago, children have enjoyed such winter folk amusements as sledding, top spinning, snowball fight and kite flying.
 A historical record says that as much snow fell in areas north of Kilju, Hamgyong Province in the early 15th century to block roads, food was transported by sledges to save people and cows. It proves that sledges had long since been used in the country.
 The top spinning, which was disseminated in the period of the Three Kingdoms, is still what children like to play in winter.    
 Through winter folk amusements, they are training their bodies and minds and deepening their knowledge of folk customs.
